clinical_study.brief_title: Cerebral Dysfunction in Chronic ITPwith High Risk of Serious Bleeding Excluding Intracranial Hemorrhage.
clinical_study.official_title: Cerebral Dysfunction in Chronic ITP With High Risk of Serious Bleeding Excluding Intracranial Hemorrhage.

brief_summary.textblock: Intracranial hemorrhage despite being rare, several chronic ITP patients experience moderate to severe behavioral problems including learning difficulties, memory affection .These changes could be due to the presence of minute capillary dysfunction

detailed_description.textblock:
- First identify the presence of cognitive, behavioral and/or minimal neurological deficit in patients with chronic ITP and correlate these changes with radiological evidence of minimal CNS bleeding.
- Second investigate the correlation between these behavioral and/or minimal neurological deficits and duration, site and severity of bleeding (a total of 200 patient of persistently low platelet count < 20x 10 9 for at least more than one month duration).
- The aim is to assess the behavioral changes in chronic ITP patients, and to assess the possible relation of such changes to duration and recurrence of very low platelet count as well as pattern of bleeding excluding frank intracranial hemorrhage.

primary_outcome.measure: cognitive, behavioral and/or minimal neurological deficit in patients with chronic ITP
primary_outcome.description: cognitive, behavioral and/or minimal neurological deficit in patients with chronic ITP and correlate these changes with radiological evidence of minimal CNS bleeding.

secondary_outcome.measure: duration, site and severity of bleeding effect of duration, site and severity of bleeding
secondary_outcome.description: behavioral and/or minimal neurological deficits and duration, site and severity of bleeding

arm_group.description: patients with chronic itp and had behavioral and or cognitive dysfunction
chronic ITP patients without cerebral dysfunction

intervention.intervention_name: IQ assessment and visual- motor assessment
intervention.description: Psychological examination and evaluation for both groups to diagnose those with behavioral and /or cognitive dysfunction.
For patients with cognitive or behavioral deficit, MRI brain and quantitative EEG will be done to identify any CNS abnormality.

study_pop.textblock: Patients will be recruited from those treated in Hematology Clinic, Ain Shams University.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Chronic ITP patients with persistent platelet count < 20 x 109/L for a period more than one month.
2. Chronic ITP with more than one attack of wet purpura and OR internal bleeding.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patients' with platelet count persistently more than 40 x 109/L.
2. Past history of intracranial hemorrhage.
3. Past history of known neurological or psychological deficit diagnosed before onset of ITP diagnosis
